results.description: We have now grown the membership to 25 members who attend weekly to build relationships and pass referrals to trusted professionals in the area. Each year I get about 25% of my new customers from meeting with the same people each week. I've gotten to know them over time and I feel confident in their abilities, so I may refer my customers to them. Great way to network with people before getting to work.  TOP Professions Needed -  Printer, Family Law/Divorce Attorney, Painter, Personal Injury Attorney, Landscaper, Photographer, Massage Therapist, Contractor, Roofer, Personal Trainer, Event/Wedding Planner,  Car Sales/Leasing, Electrician, Sign Company, HVAC among others. . .

results.description:
Learn some new tangle patterns while creating part of an "ensemble".  An ensemble is a set (usually 6 or 9) of pre-strung tiles (paper we use to draw on) that fit together to make a larger piece.  Each person will work on one of the tiles (and get to take it home), then we will put them together to admire and photograph the larger piece.

Beginners are always welcome.  (Beginners do not need to bring supplies; and will receive advice on buying supplies they may want to purchase locally or online.)

Group, meet-up membership and instruction are free; donations to defray costs, however are welcomed.

Generally Sue Schneider, organizer, brings all supplies needed for projects/instruction.  (Additional supplies you may want to use at home are available for purchase.  If you have a specific request for official Zentangle products, kits, or tools, Sue will be happy to order them for you and deliver at the meet-up--you won't have to pay shipping costs!)

If you are a regular attender, simply bring your usual kit of supplies, and any other materials that may be specified for the particular session.

Fun, inspiration and good company are guaranteed!!
results.how_to_find_us: Meeting Room A in lower level of library

results.description:
BUY TICKET NOW!

Please join us on Thursday, July 9 (second Thursday in July) from 5:30 - 8:30 PM for GlobalPittsburgh First Thursdays Happy Hour at Roland's Seafood Grill!

Our special guests will be Head of Office, World Energy Council Germany, and Head of E-Mobility Coordination Office, Saxony's Energy Agency.  The two distinguished visitors are in Pittsburgh as a part of the International Visitor Leadership Program (IVLP) sponsored by the U.S. Department of State.

Thanks to the German American Chamber of Commerce, Pittsburgh Chapter, our partner for this special event, we invite all German expatriates currently living in Pittsburgh, to attend our event with complimentary admission (<a>registration</a> is required)!

The German American Chamber of Commerce, Pittsburgh (GACC PIT) was founded in 2015 to promote and support bilateral trade between Germany and the U.S. They are a private, non-profit organization and serve as the official representative of German trade in Western Pennsylvania. GACC PIT is part of an international network composed of 130 German foreign chambers of commerce and government offices in 90 countries. For more information about the GACC Pittsburgh, please visit their <a>website</a>.

Admission is FREE for GlobalPittsburgh members, German expatriates, and those who were born in July. Non-member admission is $5 with pre-registration and $10 on the day of the event and at the door. 
BUY TICKET NOW! 

Features for the July event:


- Free admission for paid GlobalPittsburgh members and people with July birthdays

- Complimentary appetizers


- Complimentary drink for members who join/renew at the event


- Door prizes and auctions

- Interactive program and more!

Meet globally-minded people from Pittsburgh and all over the world to make new friends and learn more about different cultures at our GlobalPittsburgh First Thursdays monthly happy hour. Bring your friends, family and colleagues or come alone - it's a very friendly group!

Receive discounted membership of $40 per year for an individual/family membership when you sign up at the event - that's a 20 percent savings! 


If you have questions, would like to become a sponsor or set up a vendor table, or donate an item for the auction, please contact Nadya Kessler in the GlobalPittsburgh office at[masked] or by email at [masked]. Photos from past First Thursdays and a few other GlobalPittsburgh events, activities, and programs can be viewed at www.flickr.com/photos/globalpittsburgh. See you there!

results.description:
Welcome to Summer Iron City Aristacrats!

It's a new season and with it a new set of interesting technology topics at the Arista Iron City Meetup Group. 

For the July 9th  Meetup, we will discuss a new approach to TAP aggregation that delivers high density, non-blocking 10/40/100GbE networks to deliver an order of magnitude improvement in the economics of building cloud-scale monitoring. We will talk about a scalable end-to-end network and application monitoring with flexibility and precision, while enabling existing third-party monitoring tools to integrate directly with captured data.  We will conclude with a live demo of these products running in a lab environment, and showcase some key features.

For a preview, check out this paper by the team at Arista:

http://www.arista.com/en/solutions/technology-bulletins/585-tap-aggregation

Meetup Location:

For July, we're at the Pittsburgh Technology Council, 2000, Technology Dr, Pittsburgh, PA 15219. When you enter the PTC office, take a left and go all the way down the hall to the conference room. 
If you wish to send your full name to us privately so we can add you or guests on the list, join our meetup group and message us privately.
(drinks and pizza will be served)

If you wish to send your full name to us privately so we can add you or guests on the list, join our meetup group and message us privately.

(fresh local beer, drinks and pizza will be served)

Look for more updates or changes as the date approaches, and see you there.

Tony Williams 

(twilliams @ arista.com)

Chris Sharkey

(csharkey @ arista.com)

results.description:
Mark your calendar for the 10th Annual Silk Screen Asian American Film Festival during July 9-19

The Silk Screen Film Festival has become increasingly recognized as one of the best festivals of its kind in the world, putting Pittsburgh on the world cultural map for Asian Culture, particularly Asian Films. Silk Screen has expanded year-round programming in celebration of Asian and Asian-American arts, including educational outreach (K-12), art exhibits, theater, dance and music performances and workshops.

Certainly, the 10th anniversary of the Silk Screen Festival is a milestone that our region can take great pride in -- and this year's festival is expected to showcase many award winning films as well as the always entertaining Opening Night Gala where hundreds of guests will enjoy an evening of live music and dance as well as ethnic cuisine (Indian, Chinese, Thai, Filipino, etc.) while mingling with local celebrities at one of Pittsburgh's most anticipated events of the season!

Silk Screen is a Pittsburgh-based non-profit organization dedicated to celebrating diversity and multicultural appreciation of the Asian and Asian-American experience. With fantastic Asian food, entertainment, and open bar at the Opening Night Gala, you'll have a great time while supporting this wonderful non-profit!


Check out the 2015 festival schedule during July 10-19 which includes over 30 films!  This link contains info on all of the films, including video trailers, tickets, and film locations (such as Regent Square Theater, Melwood Screening Room) http://www.silkscreenfestival.org/film/film-festival/2015-festival-schedule/

Check out this great article about the festival and some of the featured films http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/movies/2015/07/03/Asian-film-festival-picks-a-new-season/stories/201507030082

Many of these films will be shown on two different dates, and so please feel free to post comments below (regarding the films you're most interested in attending or perhaps dates where you might be interested) and perhaps we can try to schedule some alternate dates for Meetup groups to check out various films as well as the Opening Night Gala.

We've also added a Discussion Board forum for those that may wish to suggest some films where perhaps some smaller groups of people could get together depending on their schedules. Please visit http://www.meetup.com/Art-lovers/messages/boards/thread/49083185</a>

For more information about Silk Screen and the entire festival, please visit <a href="http://www.silkscreenfestival.org">http://www.silkscreenfestival.org

Stay tuned for updates!
results.how_to_find_us: Film locations include Regent Square Theater, Melwood Screening Room, etc. Please note this is an informational posting on the entire festival, whereas separate Meetup events may be planned for specific movies

There is no requirement to register and no cost. All participants must be well. Please do bring your baby with you.

Pregnant mothers, currently breastfeeding mothers, mothers who are pumping and bottlefeeding, mothers who have breastfed in the past are all welcome to participate.

Meetings are led by a lactation consultant from Heritage Valley Sewickley. There is a scale available for weighing babies. Some meetings focus on a particular topic, but generally there is no specific topic. Specific topics can be addressed if requested by group participants.

Meetings of the Breastfeeding Moms Network are normally held on the 2nd and 4th Thursday evening of the month--except November and December when it is only the 2nd Thursday evening.

Storkbites is for all new mothers with a baby under a year old. Those meetings are on Tuesday mornings and moms can attend whether they are breast or formula feeding their babies.
results.how_to_find_us: Meetings are held on the 6th floor of the hospital in the Maternal Child Health classroom. There are blue signs posted on the evenings when there are meetings, to help you find the classroom.

results.description:
There are over 50,000 residents living in Pittsburgh's Northside neighborhoods and until now there have been no open Toastmasters clubs for these communities. 

That changes with the establishment of the Northside Toastmasters to serve the community and develop its current and future leaders. In our meetings, members present prepared speeches, receive written and oral evaluations, practice impromptu speaking, and share fellowship in a supportive, non-intimidating environment. These experiences develop our members into greater communicators while practicing essential leadership skills. 

Toastmasters is a safe place to fail, to practice, to learn, and to grow into the best leader and communicator you can be. Come visit and find out what we can do for you! 

Current Toastmasters:

Please help us make this club a success and introduce this community to the incredible benefits Toastmasters has to offer. We need help spreading the word and ensuring that meetings run smoothly. If you are interested in volunteering to speak, fulfill a meeting role, or helping to promote the club; please let me know ASAP. If you are interested in sponsoring or mentoring this club (and earning credit toward your Advanced Leader Silver award in the process) please contact me directly. 


Thank you in advance for helping to bring the benefits of Toastmasters to the diverse and underserved communities of the Northside. Your involvement makes a difference!

Please note: The club will continue to meet at this location on the 2nd & 4th Thursday of each month from 6:30-7:30pm. Meetings are free and open to the public, all are welcome!
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in the main meeting room, straight ahead through the glass doors when you enter the Library.

results.description:
7:30 p.m.: Picnic food and cash bar
9:15 p.m.: Screenings begin
$15 ($10 CMP members), includes one drink token

Drawing inspiration from the silver paintings that will be featured in CMOA’s upcoming exhibition Jacqueline Humphries, the theme for this year’s 2-Minute Film Festival is "The Silver Screen." Humphries uses metallic pigments in many of her works, layering it with a chalky black to create complex surfaces she has compared to the aesthetics of film noir: “Unlike in Western or gangster films, where you have a vertical figure against a horizontal background that he stands out from, in film noir, the figure is completely collapsed into the picture. His face is often in shadow and he is completely embedded in the atmosphere and light of the frame. I feel this captures something I am after in the paintings, of complete embeddedness."

See how filmmakers from around the globe have interpreted this unique relationship between two very different artforms. CMOA’s 2MFF reveals exactly how much can be accomplished in a mere 120 seconds and reminds us that, even under strict limitations, creativity is limitless!

Check out this great article about the 2-Minute Film Festival http://triblive.com/aande/movies/8592748-74/film-films-festival#axzz3f9zoh57H

Tickets: http://tickets.carnegiemuseums.org/cmoa/CMASE_CMACULTCLB_ACULTC0709

Watch last year's entries: http://2mff.cmoa.org/category/2014/

For more information about the Carnegie Museum of Art, including the various gallery exhibits, other upcoming events, etc., please visit www.cmoa.org
results.name: 2 Minute Film Festival @ Carnegie Museum of Art Sculpture Court

results.description:
Online News Association Code Academy

Are you interested in making your stories more dynamic, but not sure how to do it?  This four hour workshop will explore basic workflows and techniques for using data to tell stories.   We will also be using data to generate maps and charts that are dynamic and generated from real civic data provided in partnership with Pittsburgh OpenData, our Code for America brigade.  We will also explore ways to take the visualizations created and place them online!
The software we will be using is Tableau Public, the free version of Tableau, one of the most popular data visualization packages in journalism.   It works on both PCs and Macs, and is a free download at https://public.tableau.com/s/.  

Bring your own laptop.  No coding skills are required—basic computer literacy is all that's needed.  

We know that you all are busy individuals, so we are offering this workshop on two consecutive days.  Note that the content of two days will be identical—no need to come to both! If you want to make it easy on us, let us know which day you'll be attending in the comments after you've RSVP'd. You're welcome to come to both.

Workshop hours: 

Friday 9am to 1pm, Saturday 9am to 1pm

Location:

Academic Hall room 308

Presented in partnership with ONA Pittsburgh

Sponsored in part by the Knight-Mozilla OpenNews project

With contributions from War Streets Media. War Streets Media is an independent, modern-day publishing company built to deliver high quality journalism and information products. Its flagship publication and newsroom, Grant's Hill, will cover the business of governing in Pittsburgh and Allegheny County, focusing on the actions and decisions of those who work on Grant Street. Launching soon!
results.name: Data Visualization for Journalists and Media

results.description:
"The Art of Mastering Work/Life Balance (and other crazy aspirations!)"

***Friday, July 10th at 9:30am in the private room at Panera in Robinson

Is it possible to really have a balance between our work and the rest of our life? Should they be separate? Do you feel like you never have enough time to feel like you are doing well at either?

Join us to discuss strategies and share ideas on how we can bring 100% to every area of our life without burning out.

**We are meeting in the private room at Panera in Robinson. (the one near Walmart).

**Please contribute $3 for the expenses of the Meetup group.


We would love to have you join us! Just a reminder that this group is different from other women's groups that are primarily geared towards networking. Thank you for respecting the purpose of this specific group.

THIS GROUP IS NOT: 
* A place to pitch a product or service. 
* A place for you to network for customers or signups for other business groups or for your services.

THIS GROUP IS: 
* A safe space to share the specific challenges that we face as entrepreneurs. 
* The make new friends who are like-minded. 
* To encourage and inspire one another.

results.description:
Get Heard! Get Noticed! Get Leads! (TM)

Hosted by: Fran Treloar from SendOutCards and Maryann Liddle from Liddle Architectural Design

This is an informal networking event, open to any business woman who would like to increase her business contacts or clients in the Robinson/Airport area.

Things to bring:

- 10-20 business cards or marketing material

- cash for your lunch check

- $5 meeting fee (non members only)

AGENDA

1:00 pm - attendees arrive, reviews menu, gives the server their drink order, and open networking: everyone stands up to introduce oneself to others and pass their business card

1:15 pm - server takes lunch order and the sign in sheet is passed around

1:30 pm - 60 sec. commercials begin

2:00 pm - each person gives a testimony or referral for someone attending the lunch

2:30 pm - Premier member does a 5 min. company presentation

2:35 pm - WSBA announcements from Debi/Susan

2:45 pm - lunch has ended. Open networking is welcomed.

Be prepared to do a 60 second commercial about yourself. Please RSVP if you plan to attend this lunch. If your schedule becomes free the day of the lunch, then you may attend without an RSVP. This lunch is subject to cancellation when the lunch has 3 or less RSVPs.Lunch cancellation policy.

results.description:
Hi All,

We're meeting at 6:00 at the tennis court of Moon park and will play 2 hours or more.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

Olia will lead the event. Please find Olia at the court.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,

results.description:
Warm Weather Yappy Hour


Join us tonight from 6:00 to 9:00 pm

Bring your pup and join us for a Warm Weather Yappy Hour tonight from 6:00 to 9:00 pm! Enjoy free beer (for the humans) and free Barley Bones--treats made from spent brewing grains--for the dogs!

Humans must be at least 21 years of age to attend Petagogy’s Warm Weather Yappy Hour. All dogs must be on leashes (no retractable leashes, please) and must be comfortable around other dogs and people. Dogs over six months old must be spayed or neutered.

Petagogy's Warm Weather Yappy Hours are being held in conjunction with the Warm Weather FirstFriday ArtWalks along Ellsworth Avenue. Discover art galleries, hear live music, browse local shops and enjoy delicious grub from different food trucks. Yappy Hours are scheduled for May 1, July 10 and September 4 (please note--art galleries may not allow dogs to come inside).

Start at the intersection of Ellsworth and Maryland Avenues and work your way up to the Pedestrian Bridge. Local Food Trucks will be set up in the small parking lot located on Ellsworth right before the Pedestrian Bridge. Rotating throughout the summer are the Pittsburgh Taco Truck, Pittsburgh Crepes Truck and more.

For more information about the Warm Weather ArtWalks and other Shadyside events check out 

Think Shadyside

!

results.description:
Please join us for Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh -- the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust’s signature summer benefit that celebrates a vibrant downtown Pittsburgh and a world-class Cultural District which now brings in more than 2 million residents and visitors per year.

At the 9th annual Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh, you'll experience an all-inclusive evening of exuberance with visual art, music, DJ’s, comedy, dancing, performances, art, cocktails, noshes and more!


Following the free Gallery Crawl around the Cultural District, Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh, run away with the Circus After Dark and indulge in astounding performances, art, music, activities, and a wondrous dance party. Savor signature beverages and delicious treats, while enjoying a fabulous night on the town! 

Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh will offer several ticket price levels as well as discount offers (see below).

7:00 – 9:00pm –THE VIP PARTY catered by incredible Pittsburgh talent including Chef Derek Stevens of Eleven Contemporary Kitchen, Chef Curtis Gamble with Bloomfield’s Station restaurant, Chef David Bulman with Creative Culinary, Chef Jason Dalling with Habitat, and Chef Clare Lise with Bill’s Bar & Burger. Complimentary cocktails, sensational live music, and other feats of wonderment will dazzle the senses.

The VIP party will include an eclectic line-up of entertainment from performer Marti G. Cummings (a NYC based comedian, singer, and nightlife host with the hit recorded single “Real Girl), the band The Hills and the Rivers, and Jody Perigo (ukulele).  And at approximately 8:45pm, Colonel Eagleburger’s Highstepping Goodtime Band will welcome everyone downstairs for the main event.


9:00pm – midnight – THE MAIN EVENT commences at the crack of the whip, featuring desserts galore and magnificent unlimited cocktails. Games, performances, sideshow acts, art creations and more amazing feats will thrill partygoers. 

Appearing under the Big Top will be DJ Pandemic, the Trundle Manor Creepshow, and Bombyx Collective Aeriaists. And once again, they'll have the arcade and body art which have been so popular in previous Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh parties.

Dress the part in your wild, weird and wonderful getup.


Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh 2015 will offer guests the unique opportunity to sample all aspects of verve in the Cultural District while enjoying a fabulous night on the town! And with attendance of 750+ people, you become one of the stars this evening.


Following the free Gallery Crawl around the Cultural District, Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh becomes the Crawl After Dark hotspot to engage in indulgence and exuberance.  Guests gather for an evening of interactive entertainment, art, music, inventive performances, and a pulsating dance party.  Mix and mingle with other Cosmo-chic partygoers while indulging in signature beverages and delicious treats. 


First, everyone can experience the free Gallery Crawl with nearly 30 stops throughout the Cultural District from 5:30-9:00 pm before heading over to Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh which will take place inside the beautiful August Wilson Center.

Check out the video from last year's Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh which was also held at the August Wilson Center -- although this year's party will also incorporate some new twists.


https://vimeo.com/103978628

But for the Cosmo VIP treatment, you might want to get started early -- so you'll also enjoy exclusive eats, drinks, amusements from 7:00-9:00 pm. At the VIP Party, you'll enjoy an exclusive Dinner Party spread curated by a host of incredible Pittsburgh chefs complete with signature sips and amusing entertainment from 7 to 9 pm.

Then, the main Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh party at the August Wilson Center begins at 9 pm After Dark Dance Party kicks up including scrumptious desserts and sensational endless cocktails. Experience musical and interactive activities or simply dance the night away! At Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh, you become one of the stars this evening!

Check out this article where Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh 2015 was recently rated as an event not to miss by NextPittsburgh http://www.nextpittsburgh.com/events/top-10-pittsburgh-events-not-miss-july/

And check out this video segment from KDKA-TV Pittsburgh Today Live which also previews Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh 2015 http://pittsburgh.cbslocal.com/show/pittsburgh-today-live/video-3199790-cosmopolitan-pittsburgh-2015-fundraiser/

If you have never attended Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh before, please see below for information including links to newspaper articles, etc. from previous years. 

Check out this video from WPXI-TV from previous Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh http://www.wpxi.com/videos/entertainment/video-hundreds-enjoy-chic-cosmopolitan-pittsburgh/vDBG3/

For articles and photos from previous years

http://triblive.com/lifestyles/fanfare/6370669-74/pittsburgh-effect-cosmopolitan#axzz3enP1vVoJ

http://www.post-gazette.com/life/seen/2014/07/14/2014-Cosmopolitan-Pittsburgh-event-supports-Pittsburgh-Cultural-Trust/stories/201407140034

http://triblive.com/lifestyles/fanfare/4326179-74/ashley-denise-emily#axzz31VbX0UGg

http://www.post-gazette.com/life/seen/2012/07/17/Cosmopolitan-Pittsburgh-event-benefits-Pittsburgh-Cultural-Trust/stories/201207170154

http://triblive.com/lifestyles/2196076-74/dancing-pittsburgh-cosmopolitan-cultural-doug-horne-jean-kassab-katie-kevin#axzz31VbX0UGg

http://www.whirlmagazine.com/2011/08/2011-cosmopolitan-pittsburgh/

http://www.wpxi.com/gallery/entertainment/photos-hundreds-attend-cultural-trusts-cosmopolita/gDtr/#298375

http://www.post-gazette.com/life/seen/2008/07/19/Cosmopolitan-Pittsburgh/stories/200807190166

Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh will offer several ticket price levels as well as discount offers. Now in its ninth year, Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh will unveil some new surprises in showcasing the revitalization of the Cultural District and downtown Pittsburgh.

VIP ADMISSION | 7:00pm
$85 Trust members | $95 non-members | $125 day-of

VIP Party with scrumptious munchies, libations, amusements and more commences at 7:00pm

The Main Event begins at 9:00pm

Includes sweets, libations and COLOSSAL entertainment with Marti G. Cummings, The Hills and the Rivers, Jody Perigo, and Colonel Eagleburger’s Highstepping Goodtime Band

Complimentary reserved parking at Theater Square Garage the night of the event

GENERAL ADMISSION | 9:00pm
$40 Trust members | $50 non-members | $75 day-of | $25 persons 21-29 years old (Use code word DAZZLING - valid ID required at Will Call)

The Main Event kicks off at 9:00pm

Includes sweets, libations and COLOSSAL entertainment with DJ Pandemic, Trundle Manor Creepshow, Bombyx Collective Aerialist, arcade, body art, and more!

TICKETS Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh offers several ticket price levels as well as discount offers as described below. As in past years, the regular General Admission tickets are $50 -- which includes all food, drinks, entertainment, etc. from 9 pm until midnight -- when ordering your tickets in advance.  However, various discounts are available as described below.

 1) Meetup members will receive a $5 discount with the code ASTOUNDING


 2) But if you're already a member of the Pittsburgh Cultural Trust, you can save $10 by emailing Jenn at [masked] to receive a different discount code.

 3) However, there is also a special $25 ticket for persons 21-29 years old (Use code word DAZZLING - valid ID required at Will Call)

 4) Meetup members can also save on the VIP ticket (using the ASTOUNDING code) where the festivities begin at 7 PM.

The ticket price includes all food and drinks. There is nothing else to buy. All guests have to decide is whether they'd like to attend the main party from 9 PM-midnight (while checking out the free Gallery Crawl from 5:30-9 PM) or whether they'd like the Cosmo VIP experience beginning at 7 PM instead.

See below for more details. To buy tickets in advance (and save money versus paying at the door), go online: http://trustarts.culturaldistrict.org/pct_home/donation/cosmopolitan-pittsburgh-2015 or call[masked], or visit the Theater Square Box Office. When ordering your tickets in advance, Meetup members will receive a discount with the code ASTOUNDING where you'll pay just $45 (or $90 for the VIP ticket) which is a $30 savings compared to buying $75 general admission or $125 VIP tickets at the door.

And if you're 21-29, you'll save even more with the promo code DAZZLING


For more information on the VIP Party which begins at 7 PM or main party which begins at 9 PM, please visit: http://trustarts.culturaldistrict.org/pct_home/donation/cosmopolitan-pittsburgh-2015


For more information about the performers

 Marti G. Cummings,

 the Hills and the Rivers


 DJ Pandemic  

Trundle Manor Creepshow


Bombyx Collective aerialists


***Ages 21 and over ONLY*** Children will not be permitted to enter this Big Top.

Parking Here is the ParkPGH website with real-time info on downtown parking garage availability http://parkpgh.org where you can also download apps, get garage availability via text messaging, etc. You can also call[masked]-8980.

Gallery Crawl For the complete schedule of gallery exhibits, performances, and other activities taking place from 5:30-10 PM on Friday July 10 in the Cultural District downtown, please visit http://crawl.trustarts.org/

﻿For more information about Pittsburgh Cultural Trust membership levels, please visit http://www.trustarts.org/support

Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh.  Thrilling! Spectacular! Come one, come all to the greatest party in the Cultural District!

Stay Tuned for Updates!

results.description:
A WHOLE NEW CONCERT EXPERIENCE ... Theatre of Music

The Pittsburgh New Music Ensemble (PNME) offers some of the most innovative performances during summer weekends at City Theater in the South Side.  These acclaimed performances often include world premieres of new works showcasing contemporary music, dance movements, theatre, and cutting-edge video artistry.

The PNME involves unique collaborations among musicians, artists, and composers from Pittsburgh and throughout North America. Since its founding in 1976, PNME has commissioned and premiered over 200 works. 

The 2015 PNME Season begins the weekend of July 10-11, and continues for four weekends until July 31 - August 1.

﻿To check out the entire PNME 40th Anniversary season, please visit http://www.pnme.org/season/

Check out these great preview articles about PNME's upcoming concerts this summer http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/music/2015/07/07/Preview-PNME-celebrates-40-years-of-charting-new-music-territory/stories/201507070057

http://triblive.com/aande/music/8665704-74/music-ensemble-season#axzz3fSLXkkAg

Each PNME concert is unique. But to check out an example video of what these PNME concerts may be like, please visit http://www.pnme.org/videos/ or http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KrJgpZm8t00

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KrJgpZm8t00

PNME is also excited to start a new "BYO Bottle of Wine" tradition this season! Bring whatever you wish and we can cork it after the performances, while you hang with the artists and fellow audience members! Each show, a different artist or board member will prepare a food delicacy to share with you. Experience the show, then let us get to know you better over a glass of wine and some nibbles! http://www.pnme.org/news-events/

Concert #1 (July 10-11)  "THE GRAY CAT AND THE FLOUNDER" (16 BITS ABOUT BERNADETTE)

A world premiere, evening-length commission in memory of Bernadette Callery. Instrumental music, cartoons, songs, theatre, puppetry, and imagined ballet are quilted together into a narrative on life, loss, and love. Written by Kieren MacMillan, cartoons by Joe Newcomer, directed by Kevin Noe.


In addition, if you have never been to a PNME concert before, PNME graciously offers first timers a free ticket!! First timers can pick up their free ticket at the Box Office beginning at 7 PM (one hour before the concert). See below for details.

Also, as another discount bonus -- if you've been to PNME before and bring someone new, you'll pay just $15 ticket.

And if you bring two first timers, then you go for free!

These PNME Concerts are typically 1-2 hours, so it is not too long of an evening -- and is easily incorporated with other plans, such as dining before the show or going out for a drink afterwards.

MEETUP Considerations

Because of the Cosmopolitan Pittsburgh event already scheduled for July 10, the July 11 performance date has been selected for this Meetup. But if people would like to go to PNME on Friday instead on their own or in smaller groups, this is also fine.

When you RSVP, please indicate which performance date you prefer (Friday July 10 or Saturday July 11)

TICKETS (If you're not a first timer, and need to buy tickets)

Please visit http://www.pnme.org/tickets or call ShowClix 1.888.71.TICKETS [masked])

Season Package: save up to 40% with 4 tickets for $80 (or $40 students/seniors) Must be ordered in advance. Applies to weekend concerts only - 4 tickets total. Choose Friday nights or Saturday nights. Easy ticket replacement, exchange, and donation options.

Single Tickets:

◦General Admission: $25 advance

◦Students: $10 advance

*Seniors: $15 advance, $17.50 at door

Student discount applies to ages 26 & younger, or those with a full-time student ID; Senior discount applies to ages 62 & older. Limit one ticket per I.D.

•First Limers*: FREE! – only available at door beginning at 7 PM

*A first limer is a first time attendee.

*And if you bring a first timer, then you pay only $15 at the door!

*And if you bring two first timers, then you go for free!

For more information, please visit the PNME Homepage with links to videos, music, and reviews http://pnme.org

results.description:
Nikola Tesla was born 159 years ago this Friday July 10. To celebrate, the Tesla Club at HackPittsburgh is hosting some presentations related to Nikola Tesla and his work.

See Tesla Club website: http://ukranians2.wix.com/pgh-tesla-club 

 The following presentations will take place:

Presentation by Luc Berger:

•  We demonstrate Tesla's induction motor, based on the magic of ROTATING MAGNETIC FIELDS.

• As Tesla tried to do with his GIANT STEEL TOWER, we use electromagnetic fields to TRANSFER ENERGY across empty space.

•  Tesla invented the radio. See how a crystal of FOOL'S GOLD from a rock shop can be used to make a radio!

Presentation by Geno Soroka:

•  oneTesla musical tesla coil playing music via midi file, midi piano, and other methods.

•  Playing with wireless transmission of energy using Tesla coil

•  Theremin presentation

-Presentation by other High Voltage/Tesla enthusiasts: 

•  Whatever you want. Bring your Tesla Coils and related projects! 

Event starts at 7:30pm
results.how_to_find_us: Garage around back on Watson Street.
results.name: Nikola Tesla's 159th Birthday Party

results.description:
Join us for opening night of SummerFest, Friday July 10 at 7:30 pm (or other performances on July 19 and August 1) at the gilded age Twentieth Century Club in Oakland.

About this production of Marriage of Figaro:
Mozart's classic comic masterpiece, sung in English, conjures up DOWNTON ABBEY in our lively new production. This FIGARO doesn't miss a beat—musically or emotionally. A sparkling overture, the greatest ensembles ever written and divine arias tell a witty tale of the tensions between love and lust, servant and master, wife and lover. The Count has his eye on his valet's fiancée, who happens to be his wife's chambermaid. The Countess is pursued by the charming Cherubino—a boy disguised as a girl! Upstairs meets downstairs in this glorious romp.

With Chad Armstrong and SummerFest Europe's International Voice Competition winner Katarzyna Wilk, Mozart and DaPonte's opera buffa is helmed by Director Jonathan Eaton, Associate Director Sarah Young, and Conductor Walter Morales.

More on this production:
http://otsummerfest.org/events/marriage-of-figaro

Other performances: Sunday, July 19 at 2:00 pm; Saturday, August 1 at 7:30 pm.
Free pre-curtain talk before July 19 & August 1 performances. Free late night cabaret after August 1 performance.

Opening Night Party:

Mingle with the cast and crew at a private party with drinks, light bites, and cabaret performances, immediately following the opening night performance on Friday 10 July.

$35, includes one drink and light bites (cash bar also available)


Ticket Discounts:
If you are new to Opera Theater, you can receive up to three tickets at 33% off by calling the box office at[masked] or at the door. Students with ID can get rush tickets 50% off at door. Tickets start at $25, and there are a number of money saving subscription options:
http://otsummerfest.org/events/get-tickets

More on Opera Theater SummerFest:
SummerFest 2015 is four weeks of opera sung in English, an international recital series, a children's opera, and more! Enjoy the world premiere of our newly-commissioned A New Kind of Fallout, two versions of Mozart's The Marriage of Figaro, Richard Strauss' enchanting Capriccio, and Damn Yankees, the all-American musical. Performances take place at the historic Twentieth Century Club in Oakland from July 10 – August 2. http://otsummerfest.org/events or call[masked]-9687.

Check out these great articles about the Opera Theater SummerFest and the various shows during July 10 – August 2 http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/music/2015/07/09/Opera-Theater-s-SummerFest-offers-unusual-productions-to-attract-new-audiences/stories/201507090084

http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/opera-theaters-summerfest-features-rachel-carson-inspired-work/Content?oid=1838370

We've also added a Discussion Board forum for those that may wish to suggest some shows where perhaps some smaller groups of people could get together depending on their schedules. Please visit http://www.meetup.com/Art-lovers/messages/boards/thread/49092583

For more information about the beautiful, historic Twentieth Century Club, please visit http://www.thetwentiethcenturyclub.com/index.html

There is some street parking but most park across the street at Soldiers and Sailors. Detailed directions and dining options:

results.description: The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in Cleveland is having an exhibit of renowned photographer Herb Ritts. This is a fantastic opportunity to see work by one of the most influential photographers of our day. The exhibit includes 30 never before seen images, video footage, contact sheets and video interviews. I am scheduling this as an all day Meetup. We will attend the exhibit and see the Museum and then spend the day photographing the architecture and sights of Cleveland. ( it is Cleveland so that shouldn't take more than 10 min. ) Sorry, couldn't help myself. We can meet for lunch as a group and talk about our images, then go and shoot some more and meet up again later. Or we can figure out something when we get there. I think it would be wise to carpool in order to prevent people getting lost or separated. We can meet in Cranberry Twp. and go from there. The parking lot in front of Michael's in Cranberry is large and well lit.
results.name: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame -- Herb Ritts Exhibit

results.description:
This workout will consist of barbell movements and running in the following sequence:

Run 1 lap
10 power clean and jerks
Run 1 lap
10 power clean and jerks
Run 1 lap
10 power clean and jerks
Run 1 lap 
10 power clean and jerks
Run 1 lap
10 power clean and jerks
Run 1 lap

The total work done is 6 laps of running (~1.5 miles) and 50 power clean and jerks.  Athletes new to the barbell lifts will do the power cleans from the "hang" (between the knees and waste).

We will begin this workout as a group and four different barbells (25lb - 145lb) will accommodate various strength levels.  It is not a race.  The goal is to complete the sequence and encourage your fellow athletes to do the same.  The workout will build your work capacity and help you become more efficient and proficient with the barbell movements. We will keep time so that you can have a personal benchmark on the workout and make improvements.

The videos hyperlinked below illustrate the basic barbell movements.  If you are new to these, then plan to arrive at 9:00 am.  I will teach/review technique from 9:00-9:30.  If you are familiar with these movements, then you can plan to arrive at 9:20.  At least 10 minutes of warm-up is recommended for all athletes.  Group workout will begin at 9:35.

http://youtu.be/ybIjnBFpZFQ 
http://youtu.be/n_-IM881amg 
http://youtu.be/uSXHo9E9sEA 
http://youtu.be/88w6SthC-58 
http://youtu.be/m4ytaCJZpl0 
http://youtu.be/X6-DMh-t4nQ 
http://youtu.be/V-hKuAfWNUw

results.description:
What:: GASP Games Day 
Where:: Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
When:: 10am to 11pm 
Cost:: $5 (first time attendees are free)

Due to our situation in finding a new home, Games Days are currently on a month-2-month schedule. See below for the schedule, it will be updated as needed.

2015 Dates

• January - cancelled without a replacement

• February 21st - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• March 21st - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• April - Could not secure a date in April (will hold 2 in May)

• May 2nd and 23rd - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• June 13th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• July 11th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• August 8th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• August 29th - Springdale United Presbyterian Church

• September - Location and date TBD

• October - Location and date TBD

• November - No Games Day due to GASPcon

• December - Location and date TBD

The address for the church is located at the bottom of the page

Game Days run from 10am till 11pm, and are open to everyone. There is a small fee per person ($5) to attend Games Day, to cover the cost of the rental hall. This fee is waived for all first-time attendees. The fee will be collected when you arrive, and will grant access to all the games contributed by our members, for use that day. We will be holding off taking any new yearly payments, but those that did pay will be honored.

Speaking of games, there are always a multitude of board, card, role-playing, and miniature games being played on any given Game Day, but a few events are near constants.

• Our Multi-Player Magic League runs each Game Day, starting around 11am. It’s a league that runs Jan-Oct. There is a second league starting at 4:30PM with modified rules and decks, please read the forum post for more information.

• Several RPG campaigns are also run each Game Day, including our "One-Shot Saturdays", stand-alone adventures run by various GMs each month.

• There are several miniature games that regularly appear at each Game Day. These vary each month, but some examples are X-Wing, Lord of the Rings, Firestorm Armada, Dystopian Wars, Axis and Allies: War at Sea & Angels 20, BattleTech, AT-43, Infinity, and others.

• Don’t forget our extensive board game contingent. You can always find players for a board game, whether you bring your own or try out one of the many titles our BGers own and bring each month to our Games Library.

We ask that everyone attending our Game Days brings something along as a snack and/or drink, for the community to share in. The facility has a full kitchen, so items that need refrigerated are OK. Most people bring some soda, chips, cookies, veggie tray, etc. This helps everyone have a good time without worrying about snacks or drinks.

See you at Games Day!


Location Information:: 
Springdale United Presbyterian Church 
859 Pittsburgh Street 
Springdale, PA 15144

The Pittsburgh Area Model Club is sponsored by the Pittsburgh Chapter for the purpose of teaching investment club operations and BetterInvesting investment decision-making techniques.

Visitors are always welcome, and on occasion out number members. Bring your whole club, if you wish.

Anyone in the Chapter area can attend as a visitor, and is eligible to apply for membership. Visitors are encouraged to participate in our lively discussions (but only members may vote on investment decisions for the club).

Each member invests between $10 and $100 per month, and the club maintains an investment portfolio following BetterInvesting procedures.

Prerequisite:
A desire to improve your investment decisions.

results.description:
Please join the North Coast Gamers Greater Pittsburgh Area chapter Meetup group members and thousands of other fine people as we journey to see and interact with our friends at the Great Lakes Medieval Faire for a fun and festive good time.

Please feel free to RSVP if you plan to attend during one of the many upcoming events.

For more information about the GLMF, please click here. http://medievalfaire.com/index.htm

For more information about the NCG-GPA's experiences at the GLMF please click here. http://www.meetup.com/NCGGreaterPittsburghArea/boards/thread/7321988/60/

We at the NCG-GPA strongly recommend that you attend this event. I, Brom B. (Brutal Brom) have been attending Renaissance Festivals/Faires since 1994. Over the years I have developed a strong relationship with many of the local faires/festivals as well as an affinity for the fine and talented performers that bring such magic and mirth to life for us all to enjoy.

Also, if you attend any of the dates, please feel free to upload photos of your time there.

Like boardgames and card games and find yourself looking for a friendly, open group of like minded folks to throw some dice with? MEEPLE is for you. Come on out to the Carnegie Library in Oakland for an afternoon of great games and laughs. Regular attendees bring all sorts of games from simple to sophisticated, for those into gateway games to those into complex Euros. There's a space and place for all players.

You won't find a warmer welcome!

First timers, new and inexperienced players are encouraged to attend.

 If there are specific games or types of games you'd like to play, drop a note in the meetup for the group to discuss. In particular, if you have an interest in trying an RPG, please let me know so I can let you know if that can be arranged.

results.description:
Pizza, hotdogs, cinnamon buns and more....

Gluten free, vegan, unprocessed and with no refined sugar......yes, it's possible.

<<< Guests must pay in advance. See ticket link below. >>>


A part of the monthly Saturday Superfood Brunch series, this is a one-of-a-kind slow food event that typically runs for 2 hours, allowing guests to eat mindfully, socialize, network, have intellectual conversations, get informed about healing superfood ingredients and enjoy themselves while the food comes out course after course. By eating mindfully and not loading up on empty calories and carbs, guests leave more than full, nourished and satisfied. Table manners will be expected and very appreciated.

Milestones:

http://vstw.net/2015/04/an-evolution-of-eating/

http://www.muddymelissa.com/2015/04/12/review-zest-wishes-vegan-brunch/

http://pittsburgh.cityvoter.com/best/brunch/great-meals/pittsburgh

http://www.post-gazette.com/life/munch/2014/08/28/Munch-goes-to-Schwartz-Living-Market/stories/201408280139

http://www.wonderaddo.com/index.php/family-friendly-vegan-brunch/

http://muddymelissa.blogspot.com/2014/01/vegan-brunch-featuring-chef-mya-zeronis.html?spref=fb

http://www.pittsburghmagazine-digital.com/pittsburghmagazine/january_2014/?pg=104&pm=1&u1=friend#pg104

http://www.post-gazette.com/life/recipes/2013/09/19/Food-Column-Cook-and-learn-at-pop-up-dinner/stories/201309190282

http://www.popcitymedia.com/features/creativedinners0918.aspx

Enjoy a-whole-new-level vegan brunch items crafted by Chef Mya Zeronis of Lean Chef en Route/extraVEGANza, using GMO-free, local, organic ingredients and NO refined sugar, gluten, factory-produced, processed, packaged, textured mock meats, vegetable protein isolates TVPs and packaged, processed vegan cheeses.

Chef Mya Zeronis hails from meat-centric, butter-drowned, flour-covered U.S. restaurant kitchens but identified a need for healthful foods in Pittsburgh and made it her business in 2013. Her business aims to make healthy eating and sustainable living accessible. Nearly a dozen of her recipes won top prizes in national and local contests. Some others were published in magazines and cookbooks. She never attended a culinary school. Cooking comes to her naturally.

[4 BEVERAGES]
Juice counter for make-your-own raw fresh juice blends:
Orange Glow organic carrots, Mandarin oranges, pineapples, ginger
Beet Me Up watermelon, berries, beets, cayenne

Chilled organic house-brewed, loose-leaf green tea with lemon
Organic, fair-trade coffee with homemade organic rolled oat-banana milk and grade B dark organic maple syrup


[10 DISHES]
This is a 2-hour-long slow food event that allows guests to eat mindfully, socialize, network, have conversations and enjoy themselves while the food comes out course after course. By eating mindfully and not loading up on empty calories and carbs, guests go home more than full, nourished and satisfied. Table manners expected.

1)Raw pizza with flax-oat-sunflower seed crust, spinach-cashew pesto, sliced tomatoes, basil, pea shoots
2)Mixed baby greens with chopped walnuts, raw apple cider-maple vinaigrette, apples, red onions
3)Scrambled cauliflower-chick pea eggs with coconut milk, turmeric, nutritional yeast, scallions
4)Carrot hotdogs marinated with sesame oil. apple cider vinegar, non GMO-project-verified light tamari. Served with millet buns and toppings: pickled watermelon rinds, pickled beets, homemade Sriracha, sauerkraut, grainy mustard
5)Asian-inspired, house sriracha-spiced black bean chili with, peppers, scallions, tamari
6)Homemade sprouted tofu-oat chorizo and potato hash with red onions, avocado oil, multi-color peppers
7)Chilled raw avocado-cucumber soup with walnut cream, cumin, cilantro, extra virgin olive oil, lemon
8)Quinoa-brown rice pasta, pine nut parmesan, tomato bell pepper basil sauce, parsley, Wild Purveyors portobello steak
9)Raw cinnamon buns with pecans, flax, dates, raisins, coconut butter, maple
10)Naturally-sweet blueberry-banana-coconut ice cream

Raw fresh ingredients are washed three times using baking soda-sea salt-filtered water solution.

Up to two children age 7 or younger, accompanied by paying adult, eat free. For each additional child or those 8-14, the cost is $10 and it's donated to No Kid Hungry.

Please email organizer well in advance if you have any food sensitivities and allergies. If bringing children under 7 years of age, please let organizer know how many.

This is reservation-only event and guests must pay in advance. Cutoff is two days prior to event. Want to get this brunch and upcoming brunches for $15 each? Sign up for a one-year Born To Brunch membership. http://july11brunch.brownpapertickets.com/
results.name: Superfood Brunch Remix: Old-time Faves & New Creations

Lawrenceville Historical Society & Allegheny Cemetery Historical Association will present the 2015 Stephen Foster Music and Heritage Festival (aka “Doo Dah Days!”). 7/11 in celebration of Foster’s birth and legacy. Four musical performances featuring the music of Stephen Foster. The Doo Dah Days festival has educational tours of Allegheny Cemetery (including Foster’s burial place), costumed re-enactors and other outdoor activities. Also on hand will be food vendors and other organization tables.

results.description:
The Lineup for this event! 


http://deutschtownmusicfestival.org/schedule/

Deutschtown Music Festival (NO COVER at any location!)

Location: All of the Northside

Recommend the MAIN STAGE and the WIGLE Whiskey Stage

Also there are SCHOOL BUSES that take people to the different stages and locations!

Main stage address: Corner of James Street and Suismon Street

Wigle Barrelhouse stage address:1055 Spring Garden Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15212

Time:11am to 8pm for Outdoor, indoor 11am to 1am

On Saturday, July 11, 2015, the third annual Deutschtown Music Festival promises to be bigger and better than ever. Taking place in and near the Deutschtown neighborhood of Pittsburgh’s North Side, the festival will offer an entirely free day and night of live music and entertainment to an expected audience of 15,000 people.

Promoting the Northside as well as local musicians and artists, the 2015 festival will feature four outdoor stages. At least 17 indoor stages will host bands with music to satisfy just about any ear – jazz, blues, rock, folk, bluegrass, electronic, and more.

More than 100 bands will play this year, each of them willing to donate their time and talent. “The Deutschtown Music Festival is and always will be free in at least some capacity,” says Cody Walters, the festival’s founder.

http://deutschtownmusicfestival.org/schedule/

Deutschtown Music Festival (NO COVER at any location!)

Location: All of the Northside

Recommend the MAIN STAGE and the WIGLE Whiskey Stage

Also there are SCHOOL BUSES that take people to the different stages and locations!

Main stage address: Corner of James Street and Suismon Street

Wigle Barrelhouse stage address:1055 Spring Garden Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15212

Time:11am to 8pm for Outdoor, indoor 11am to 1am


On Saturday, July 11, 2015, the third annual Deutschtown Music Festival promises to be bigger and better than ever. Taking place in and near the Deutschtown neighborhood of Pittsburgh’s North Side, the festival will offer an entirely free day and night of live music and entertainment to an expected audience of 15,000 people.

Promoting the Northside as well as local musicians and artists, the 2015 festival will feature four outdoor stages. At least 17 indoor stages will host bands with music to satisfy just about any ear – jazz, blues, rock, folk, bluegrass, electronic, and more.

More than 100 bands will play this year, each of them willing to donate their time and talent. “The Deutschtown Music Festival is and always will be free in at least some capacity,” says Cody Walters, the festival’s founder.

Franks Number for TXT'ing is[masked], I'll be close to the main stage or I might wander down to the Wigle Whiskey Barrelhouse Stage.

Recommend the MAIN STAGE and the WIGLE Whiskey Stage

Also there are SCHOOL BUSES that take people to the different stages and locations!

Main stage address: Corner of James Street and Suismon Street

Wigle Barrelhouse stage address:1055 Spring Garden Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15212

Time:11am to 8pm for Outdoor, indoor 11am to 1am

On Saturday, July 11, 2015, the third annual Deutschtown Music Festival promises to be bigger and better than ever. Taking place in and near the Deutschtown neighborhood of Pittsburgh’s North Side, the festival will offer an entirely free day and night of live music and entertainment to an expected audience of 15,000 people.

Promoting the Northside as well as local musicians and artists, the 2015 festival will feature four outdoor stages. At least 17 indoor stages will host bands with music to satisfy just about any ear – jazz, blues, rock, folk, bluegrass, electronic, and more.

More than 100 bands will play this year, each of them willing to donate their time and talent. “The Deutschtown Music Festival is and always will be free in at least some capacity,” says Cody Walters, the festival’s founder.

“But what we heard over and over last year was that people wanted to give the bands a little something as thanks. This year, we started a crowdfunding campaign to raise $10,000 to allow us to pay each band a small token of our appreciation. It gives the attendees a way to show how much they value the time and effort of the performers.”

The Indiegogo campaign can be found at https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/deutschtown-music-festival.

results.description:
Cross-posted to the meetup group </a><a href="http://www.meetup.com/Pittsburgh-anxiety-shyness-depression/">Pittsburgh area anxiety, shyness and depression meetup.

*Please note the change in date and that this meetup was extended by half an hour*


Snacks and pop are permitted at this meetup and will be provided by the event organizer. 

Due to request at past meetups from our members, there was interest in having a small (10-15 members or so) capped meetup at a South Hills library location. This will be the second library meetup at the Brookline library. We would like to host informal library talks from time to time. The Brookline library is conveniently located and has reserved spots for us in the smaller study room. This room accommodates up to 20 people.

Parking is at metered diagonal spots along the side of the street the library is on, or parallel parking is available on the opposite side of the street. Parking is rarely a challenge on Brookline Blvd. but is metered on Saturdays, so it may cost a few dollars to park for the two hour meetup. Free parking may be available on side streets if you don't mind a bit of walking.

Topics will be anything anyone would like to discuss--anything good that you experienced this week, steps you made to challenge your anxieties, ideas for future meetups, or anything else related to the group's subject. Our goal is to keep the library events for this Meetup group small and will be capping the event. Feel free to message me with any topics you would like to see discussed at these types of meetups and we will make sure you have a chance to have your voice heard.

Hope to see you there!
results.how_to_find_us: The library is just south of the Liberty Tunnels along Brookline Blvd. Zip code is 15226 for GPS users.
results.name: Let's meet up and have a talk at the library

group.name: Let's End Isolation caused by depression, anxiety

results.description:
Hi All, I am so excited because this is our first meetup!

During our meet up, we will be meditating as a group on the ‘Meditation on Twin Hearts (MTH)’. The following will be the rough agenda of our meet up!

We will first introduce ourselves and after getting to know who is who, we will have a brief description of the guided meditation.

We will do a simple set of exercise to prepare the body for meditation. This will take about 5 mins

The main event, Meditation on Twin Hearts will take about 20 mins. This is a very powerful meditation which involves very simple yet effective techniques to maximize the meditation experience. You have to try it to feel it! Regular MTH can do wonders for physical, emotional, mental and spiritual well-being.

This will be followed by the same set of exercise and sharing of our experiences.

Then on, we can hang out and interact or go home 

Please give yourselves about 2 hours for the event.

It is a free event. Although, you are welcome to donate to help cover cost of the event space!

Looking forward to meeting you all !

Jeevitha
Phone:[masked]
email: [masked]
results.name: Let us meditate!

results.description:
What: Two hour timed painting competition. Registration fee is $10 for all participants.


Who: Artists of all skill and experience levels. This event is for adult artists as well as for younger artists ages 13-18  who will be considered “Junior” level participants and eligible for the “Junior Award” 

Where: Featured Garden Tour locations in Regent Square


When: Sunday, July 12. Painting time from 10:00 to 1:00 pm. Judging & Exhibit 2:00-3:00 pm 

For more information, please visit http://www.wsccpgh.org/vlt66953.htm

Wilkins School Community Center

First Annual Garden Tour Plein Air Art Competition

Artists of all skill and experience levels are invited to participate!

Plein Air Competition Rules and Registration

What:  Two hour timed painting competition. Registration fee is $10 for all participants.

Who:  Artists of all skill and experience levels.  Artists ages 13-18 will be considered “Junior” level participants and eligible for the “Junior Award”

Where:  Featured Garden Tour locations

When:  Sunday, July 12. Painting time from 10:00 to 1:00 pm. Judging & Exhibit 2:00-3:00 pm

1.MATERIALS: Participants are required to bring all materials necessary for their work to be completed (canvas, watercolor paper, paint, water, brushes, easel, etc.). Participants are also strongly encouraged to bring an umbrella large enough to cover their work area.

2.OPTIONAL FRAME OR MAT: Each painting may framed or matted for presentation in the exhibit. Hint: Pre fit the canvas or mat, etc. so your finished work may easily be slipped into & secured in your frame or mat. WSCC will not provide any framing supplies.

3.SITES:  Upon registration, artists will be notified of their assigned location. Gardens are located in Swissvale, Edgewood, Wilkinsburg and Pittsburgh areas adjacent to Regent   Square.

4.SET UP: Artists will be assigned to a Garden Tour location on a first come first served basis at check-in time at 9:30 at WSCC. Artists may not set up their equipment before 10:00 on the day of the Garden Tour. WSCC may limit the number of participants according to available garden space.

5.BEGIN PAINTING: Artists may begin to create their artwork at 10:00 am. The artist must start with nothing pre-painted, pre-drawn or pre-sculpted and create the artwork ONLY during the competition timeframe of 10:00 to 1:00. If these rules are violated, the participant will be banned from future events.

6.STOP PAINTING All artists must stop painting and finish their artwork by 1:00 pm.

7.EXHIBIT AND JUDGING: At 1:00 pm, all artists bring their completed work and their easels to WSCC. Event staff will assist participants in setting up their easels for the exhibit. Judging begins at 2:00 pm, with prizes awarded by 2:30 pm. All artwork must remain until the Exhibit concludes at 3:00 pm. All artwork and easels must be picked up by 3:00 pm. WSCC is not responsible for any equipment or artwork left after 3:00 pm.

8.      SALE:   Artists may handle their own sales and are responsible for paying appropriate PA sales tax.  WSCC gratefully accepts donations of a portion of the sale price as determined by the artist. 20% donation is suggested.

Awards: 

First prize                                        $100

Second Prize                                   $ 50

Third prize                                       $ 25

Junior prize (18 and under)         $ 50
results.name: Garden Tour Plein Air Art Competition

Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!

Our presenter Sharon is a certified Naturopath and Matrix Energetics Practitioner. She has been involved with animals all of her life, including breeding and showing dogs. results.description:
Hosted by: http://rebekahgambleholisticpractitioner.com/

C’mon down and help me make some memories in my new office space in Pittsburgh, PA! There will be a free open house from 4pm to 7pm in which you can learn about the services offered at my new location, meet some of the practitioners who will be co-hosting events there, and sample some of the services.

We will have the ionic foot bath ready to try, reiki and unified energy therapy demonstrations, acupressure pointers, and essential oils to sample. There will be herbs, essential oil products and other goodies to share! I’ll be available personally to answer your questions on our upcoming events calendar and services at this location, and I’ll have some of my books available for you to take a look at and purchase if it suits your fancy. There will, of course, also be coffee and tea. There will also be a gift basket raffle. The raffle is one free ticket per person, and $1 a ticket after that. We will have other giveaways too.

Come on down, bring a friend, and enjoy the new cozy atmosphere and conversation and try some samples. There will be a free gift for the first fifteen people in the door, and discounts available on our services for those who attend and book a session.

I hope to see you there!

P.S. I may not have a sign in the door by the time of this event, but the space will be ready for you. Look for the blue door with DeFilippo Chiropractic advertised in the left window, and you know you're in the right place!
Street parking is available, as well as a small parking lot about a block away. Also, there is some great middle eastern food literally across the street with excellent vegetarian options.
results.name: Office Warming Party and Open House

results.description:
Time changed to 4:00 PM since market food stalls usually close by 4:00.  Come early if you want to get something to eat from one of the food vendors.

Meetup at Red Star Kombucha Sunday, July 12 4:00 PM Inside the Pittsburgh Public Market in the Strip District: 2401 Penn Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15222

http://www.inglobwetrust.com/

Did you know that the latest drink craze Kombucha is actually made from tea? This fermented tea is a refreshing effervescent drink that has a very low alcohol content, around 2.5% abv. It is served cold, has a bit of carbonation and comes in a variety of flavors like Original Green and Zingerbuch ginger & hibiscus.We will meet at the Red Star Kombucha “Buch Bar” inside the Pittsburgh Public Market in the strip at 4:00PM. The founder of Red Star will describe to us how Kombucha is made. We can then sample and buy Kombucha to either enjoy by the glass at the Buch Bar or to take home. Growlers are available for sale or you may bring your own empty growler bottle to fill. The Buch Bar is scheduled to close at 6:00PM but will stay open later to accommodate our group.There is plenty of free street parking on Sundays in the strip. 

Please Note: This event is for 21+ year old only.
results.name: Learn and sample Kombucha - fermented Tea beverage at Red Star Kombucha Buch Bar

results.description:
Ukulele players of all skill levels are invited to come and Jam at Hambone's Pub. Come to play ukulele, sing along, or even just to watch. We play from 5-7 pm.

Come earlier and sample Hambone's menu; meet other players over a beverage or just tune up. The beer is cold and the food is GREAT! Parking is free on Sundays and there is a small city lot across the street from Hambone's.

We are going to try a new format for this jam.  Rather than having a set playlist participants will choose songs from either of the "Daily Ukulele" books or from the song list that will be projected on the screen.  We will make every effort to insure that everyone has a clear view of the screen. 


We had a lot of fun using this format on the retreat so let's give it a try at Hambones.

I'm hoping fore a good turnout this Sunday.

Drew.


PS:   Sign up now to attend this "Jam."  See you at Hambone's.

results.description:
2 Rules for the meet up:

1) No solicitation of services *cool if someone comes to you but consultants/lawyers/coaches beware, any sales pitches and you'll have to find a new Monday ritual

2) Make sure to state whether what you are saying is an opinion or fact (both very much welcome) so to not confuse anyone about where the point of view comes from

Location change: Repair The World - 6022 Broad St. (Around the corner from Zeke's Coffee - grab your coffee from there and head over)

Share or listen to ideas but don't be fooled this is not startup therapy or feeding the ego this is about getting to work and removing the obstacles to make your idea a reality.

All entrepreneurs are welcome and it's not uncommon for us to have musicians, artists, chefs, writers, developers, renovators, or just about anyone else you can think of join the conversation.
results.name: Get your ideas or business UNSTUCK!

results.description:
Entrepreneurs helping each other. Bring your ideas, questions and experiences. Providing face-to-face help and feedback for your business in bite-sized chunks.

This meetup is right after the Unstuck Entrepreneur Meetup http://www.meetup.com/unstuckmondaymeetup/ which is right there at Repair the World from 8-9AM. Think about coming to BOTH!


After meeting outside in the lobby of Repair the World / Alpha Lab Gear / Thrill Mill, we adjourn upstairs to Alpha Lab Gear.

If you’re attending, check-in on the Sunday conference Call, RSVP here, let me know at another meetup or email me at [masked] so we’re sure to gather everyone.

This meetup is run by an experienced entrepreneur who started a business, ran it for over 20 years and successfully exited to a public company. He now keeps busy mentoring for a nationally recognized accelerator, reviewing business plans/pitches for investors and consulting for businesses & non-profits. When asked “why do a meetup?” he says he is looking to “pay it forward” by helping people make less mistakes than he made.

Who's up: Nick

 

We are being offered free use of the meeting room, and are therefore guests.  The Children's Institute has asked that we not park in their lot (handicapped members excepted; if you have plates or a placard, you can park in the lot), but park on the street.  There is parking on Shady Avenue.  The main entrance is on Shady.  You must register with the reception desk.  We meet in Room 220, which can be difficult to find if you've not been there before, so it is best to arrive early so the intrepid, experienced members who already know the way can lead you.  Bringing breadcrumbs is optional, but be aware that they clean and polish the floors in the evenings, and this is even more effective than birds for removing trails of breadcrumbs.  If you arrive late for your first meeting, ask the receptionist for directions.  Also be aware that anyone found wandering the halls muttering "220, 220..." after 9pm will be swept out with the trash.

results.description:
Hi All,

We're meeting at 7:30 at the tennis court of Schenley park and will play 2 hours or more.
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 


 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If a member is on the waiting list they can still come, however they may have to wait for courts to become available.
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,
results.name: Monday evening tennis for all levels.

results.description:
This is not a FORMAL MEETUP. We share this information with you because it is a metaphysics event in Pgh that you may enjoy attending. Here are the details about this event:
Fellow Ambassadors to the Universe, and Ambassadors to be. Trained and untrained are welcome!

Join with a group of people who want to raise our level of awareness, and continue to make contact with Extra-Terrestrial and Spiritual beings of other realms. 

Dress for outdoors, and BRING A LAWN CHAIR to sit upon. 

Seekers of the Truth: 

John Bernhard will lead this training effort; Both John (and Larry) have been on week-long trips with Dr. Steven Greer. http://www.cseti.org   Greer has devoted his life to: revelation of the Truth about ET's; how we can make contact with them directly; and, raising the Consciousness level of the planet. During this session we will:
1. Talk about the intention of the Contact
2. Educate you about the various contact methods/devices
3. Perform the protocol using a guided meditation and a quiet meditation. (For the actual contact we will generally be in darkness beneath the night sky, just after sunset)
4. Talk about equipment/gear/tools needed for our nighttime contacts 

If you own a smart phone, down load "ET Contact Tool" for Apple or Android and listen to the meditations (this is what we're about). 

In the meantime, and in preparation for this training, meditate on your own, and prepare yourself for the Loving Presence of our Brethren from afar. You might even make the intention at bedtime to have information delivered to you in your dreams (we did this extensively in AZ). Raise your aspiration level! (In all aspects of life). 

A major concern and purpose of training is that each and every one of you participating in a night time meeting must be comfortable with making contact. If a fear-ridden person is in the group, the ET's will know/sense it, and will not make contact with us as it will frighten that person. 

After training, if you cannot yet be comfortable with the concept of actual Contact, please withdraw yourself from the outdoor portion of this group in deference to the others. Continue to meditate and make contact in your own terms until you are ready. 

We have nearly always made Contact during each night time session in the form of messages, lights in the sky and even lights (light Beings) amongst our group.
We hope you will be able to join us, expand our meditative strength and group awareness.

If you know other people who wish to make their contact with the ET's, you may invite them for this training session. (You may not invite a new person to a night time Contact Session on your own: initial training is required). 


FOR FURTHER INFORMATION please contact Larry [masked]

If you email him personally that you are coming, he will be able to inform you about a cancellation.

In Peace and Love for All That Is, Larry and John 

We use the CE-5 Protocol in our contacts. http://www.cseti.org

DIRECTIONS TO THE TRAINING: 

• On Blackburn Rd,1/8 mile uphill from the YMCA complex.

•  Look for stone walls on the LEFT as you go up the hill. 

• We are Usually in the rear of the park in an isolated location. But will relocate to shelter if it is raining. 

• Meet in parking lot. 

• bring lawn chair.

results.description:
Here is a great opportunity to experience 8 Terrific short films from all over the world as part of the 10th Annual Silk Screen Asian American Film Festival during July 9-19.

And as a bonus, we'll also have a chance to check out the unique PhAb Now! abstract photography exhibit in the Filmmakers Galleries (which is also located inside the Melwood Screening Room lobby) before the film.  This exhibit features seven artists who use the photographic process for abstract experimentation with light and image, discovery and play.

The 8 Short Films that will be screened at this year's Silk Screen Film Festival include the following (Film -- Title | Duration | Director Name)

1-0 | 1 min | Saman Hosseinpuor

A boy is distracted from his haircut by an engrossing soccer match.

Custody | 5 min | Mansi Jain
A woman is confronted by her lover’s wife. The conversation does not turn out quite the way she expected.

Elegy | 30 min | Yousef Kargar

An elderly man patiently waits for news of his son who disappeared years before.

The Flip | 22 min | Chung Lam
A young boy tries to learn a new skill for his school talent show to impress his mother.

It’s Drizzling | 25 min | Lien Chien Hung
Three teenagers attempt to exploit a store owner but fall into some zany misadventures along the way.

The Park | 2 min | Sagar Shiriskar
An old man remembers his frivolous days playing on the playground.

The Ring of Love | 15 min | Xiaoyan Fu
A man shirks his responsibility to his pregnant girlfriend and she leaves. When he realizes he can’t live without her, will he be able to find her again?

Yari Road | 20 min | Samrat Chakrabarti
When three friends reunite after two years apart, it seems egos may get in the way of friendship.

About the Silk Screen Asian American Film Festival The Silk Screen Film Festival has become increasingly recognized as one of the best festivals of its kind in the world, putting Pittsburgh on the world cultural map for Asian Culture, particularly Asian Films. Silk Screen has expanded year-round programming in celebration of Asian and Asian-American arts, including educational outreach (K-12), art exhibits, theater, dance and music performances and workshops.  Silk Screen is a Pittsburgh-based non-profit organization dedicated to celebrating diversity and multicultural appreciation of the Asian and Asian-American experience.

Tickets are $10. We expect tickets to be available at the door, but advance tickets can also be purchased online https://www.showclix.com/event/ShortFilmCollection8771060 or by calling ShowClix at[masked]

Please note there are some discounts available, especially for those that will be attending a number of films at this year's festival.  For more information on discount ticket options such as a 2015 Festival Ticket 4-Pack (where you can save $10) as well as tickets for the Opening Night Gala, please visit http://www.silkscreenfestival.org/store/products/category/events/


Check out the 2015 festival schedule during July 10-19 which includes over 30 films!  This link contains info on all of the films, including video trailers, tickets, and film locations (such as Regent Square Theater, Melwood Screening Room) http://www.silkscreenfestival.org/film/film-festival/2015-festival-schedule/

Check out these great articles about the festival and some of the featured films http://www.post-gazette.com/ae/movies/2015/07/03/Asian-film-festival-picks-a-new-season/stories/201507030082

http://triblive.com/aande/movies/8666032-74/film-screen-silk#axzz3fSLXkkAg
